page.title: 10LIFE OF ILLSTON FARMER
page.content: Mr. Ian Nourish owns Bleak House Farm near Illston-on-the-Hill. He is a small, independent farmer using his land for a variety of purposes. He farms 80 acres of his own and 100 acres of glebelands which he rents. He lives on the farm with his wife, Liz, and two young children, one attends the Primary School at Billesdon. His nephew, Richard, works the farm with him. A day starts at 6.15 a.m. with a cooked breakfast. He then, without fail, spends three hours with his animals - milking his 70 strong dairy herd and then feeding any young calves he may have. He has a small milking parlour, which deals with four cows at a time and the milk is drawn into a bulk tank which is collected daily by a milk tanker lorry.
